Get spatial balance metric for each rep
```{r}
# use the `Spbsampling` function
dist_mat <- as.matrix(dist(qc_cand_points %>% 
                             dplyr::mutate(lon = sf::st_coordinates(.)[,1], 
                                           lat = sf::st_coordinates(.)[,2]) %>%
                             as_tibble() %>%
                             select(-x)))

samplesize_sim <- samplesize_sim %>%
  group_by(sample_size) %>%
  mutate(inc_prob = sample_size/n_distinct(qc_cand_points$id))

# get dataframes of inclusion probabilities
# eqprob_pik<- samplesize_sim %>% 
#   select(sample_size) %>%
#   distinct() %>%
#   mutate(inc_prob = sample_size/n_distinct(qc_cand_points$id))
# 
# strata_pik <- strata_sim %>%
#   select(inc_prob, ECO_NUM, sample_size) %>%
#   distinct()

# This calculates inclusion probabilities for an equal probability study design
sb_df <- samplesize_sim %>%
  #filter(simid %in% c("1_10_srs","1_10_grts","1_10_cube","1_10_scps","1_10_lpm1","1_10_lpm2")) %>%
  group_by(simid) %>%
  group_map(~{
    n <- n_distinct(.x$id)
    N <- dim(dist_mat)[1]
    pik <- rep(n/N,N)
    
    id_vec <- unique(.x$id)
    
    .x %>%
      select(algorithm, sample_size, rep) %>% 
      distinct() %>%
      mutate(sb = Spbsampling::sbi(dist_mat, pik, id_vec))
  })

sb_balance <- function(data, samples_df){
  samples_df %>%
    select(sample_size, inc_prob, contains("ECO_NUM")) %>%
    distinct()
}
```
